newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria invites bids for telecom sale adviser.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria invites bids for telecom sale adviser.

text.p: Bulgaria's Privatisation Agency on Friday said it was inviting investment banks to bid to advise the government in the partial sale of the state-owned Bulgarian Telecommunication Company (BTC).

"The government of Bulgaria seeks to appoint a leading investment bank with significant experience in the privatisation of national telecommunication companies in Europe, as a financial advisor," an agency statement said.
The Bulgarian government has approved the sale of up to 25 percent of BTC.
The agency will accept letters of intent by October 30 from those, interested in being shortlisted, it said.
Officials have said the Privatisation Agency and the BTC would have separate consultants.
Deputy Prime Minister Doncho Konakchiev said last week a government committee would open the offers of the bidders.
